marketNews.title: Compilation of Stock Purchases by Controllers and Directors Amid IHSG Volatility
marketNews.content: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose by 1.11% on the day. The headline notes that TEBE has a new controlling shareholder. The compilation of news for today, 20 March 2025, follows a week of heightened volatility in the IHSG, during which the exchange (BEI) imposed a trading halt on Tuesday (18 March) after a sharp decline. The compilation lists the purchases made by company controllers and directors after the halt. The key takeaway states that these purchases may signal confidence in each company's fundamentals and could support the IHSG, but a rise in investor confidence—especially from foreign investors—is needed for a more significant market recovery.

marketNews.title: U.S. Federal Reserve Holds Interest Rates at 4.25%–4.5% on 19 March 2025
marketNews.content: The United States Federal Reserve kept its benchmark federal funds rate unchanged at a range of 4.25%–4.50% on Wednesday, 19 March, according to a statement from the Fed. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said the decision was made amid economic uncertainty, potential inflationary pressures and rising unemployment as the new administration implements import tariffs. The Fed maintained its projection of two rate cuts by the end of 2025, unchanged from the December 2024 outlook. However, the Fed now projects U.S. economic growth at 1.7% for 2025, down from a previous 2.1% forecast, while inflation is expected to be 2.7% in 2025, up from 2.5% previously.

marketNews.title: Gold Prices Reach Record High After Fed Decision
marketNews.content: Spot gold prices rose 0.5% to US$3,047.8 per troy ounce in the evening trade on Wednesday, 19 March, following the Federal Open Market Committee meeting. The price later climbed to US$3,057.2 per troy ounce on Thursday, 20 March, marking an all-time high.

marketNews.title: DEN Chairman Says President Prabowo to Meet Market Participants After Trading Halt
marketNews.content: The Chairman of Indonesia's National Economic Council (DEN), Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, said President Prabowo Subianto will meet with Indonesian capital-market participants in the near future. The comment came after a 30-minute trading halt on Tuesday, 18 March, which was triggered by a daily decline of more than 5%. Luhut noted that a sharp fall in the IHSG is a normal occurrence for any stock market, with similar episodes observed in other countries at different times.

marketNews.title: BDIA Forms Joint Venture with Digital Realty to Expand Data-Center Capacity
marketNews.content: Digital Infrastructure Asia (BDIA) has formed a 50-50 joint venture with global data-center operator Digital Realty, named Digital Realty Bersama. BDIA’s subsidiary, Bersama Digital Data Centres, will be merged into the joint venture. The venture’s majority shareholders are Provident Capital Partners, Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG), a consortium led by Macquarie Asset Management, and Distro Hub. Vice President Commissioner of Digital Realty Bersama, Setyanto Hantoro, said the JV currently operates two data-center sites in Jakarta (CGK 10 and CGK 11) with capacities of 1.5 MW and 5 MW respectively, and plans to expand CGK 11 to 32 MW.

marketNews.title: People’s Bank of China Holds Benchmark Lending Rates Steady
marketNews.content: The People’s Bank of China (PBoC) kept its benchmark lending rates unchanged, leaving the one-year rate at 3.1% and the five-year rate at 3.6%, in line with market expectations. Analysts say a pressured yuan remains the main obstacle to further monetary easing. The PBoC had indicated a week earlier that it would cut rates and relax the required reserve ratio when conditions were appropriate.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Announces Housing Stimulus and Tax Waivers for Low-Income Homes
marketNews.content: Housing and Settlement Minister Maruarar Sirait (Ara) announced that President Prabowo Subianto has ordered an acceleration of low-income housing (MBR) provision through a set of policy measures. The package includes eliminating the Land and Building Acquisition Duty (BPHTB) from 5% to 0%, waiving the Building Permit Fee (PBG), and the government covering Value-Added Tax (PPN) until June 2025. Ara also reported that more than 130,000 subsidised houses had been built and delivered as of March 2025.

marketNews.title: Five Investors Sign Land-Utilisation Agreements with OIKN
marketNews.content: The head of the State-Owned Enterprises Oversight Agency (OIKN), Basuki Hadimuljono, said on Wednesday, 19 March, that five investors have signed land-utilisation agreements (ADP) with OIKN and a notarial deed. The investors are PT Citadel Group Indonesia, PT Berkat Kalimantan Abadi, PT Perintis Pondasi Teknotama, PT Perintis Power Investment, and PT Sentra Unggul Nusantara, with a total investment value of IDR 2.42 trillion.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Parliament Passes Controversial Military Law Amendments
marketNews.content: The Indonesian House of Representatives approved an amendment to the Armed Forces Law that would allow more civilian positions to be filled by military officers. Critics argue the change could return Indonesia toward the New Order era. The amendment requires officers to resign from the military before taking a civilian post and bars them from joining state-owned enterprises to avoid concerns over military involvement in business.

tickerNews.title: TEBE Gains New Controlling Shareholder After PT Dua Samudera Purchases 39.31% Stake
tickerNews.content: Dana Brata Luhur’s subsidiary PT Dua Samudera Perkasa bought approximately 505 million shares (39.31%) of TEBE at a price of IDR 500 per share from PT Prima Mineral Utama on 18 March 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 252 billion. After the deal, PT Dua Samudera’s ownership in TEBE rose from 31.84% to 71.14%, while PT Prima Mineral’s stake fell from 39.31% to zero. PT Dua Samudera Perkasa is now the controlling shareholder and will conduct a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: OCBC NISP Approves 2024 Dividend of IDR 2.4 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP announced on Thursday, 20 March, that its shareholders approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately IDR 2.4 trillion, representing a 49.98% dividend payout ratio (2023: 40.4%). The dividend equates to IDR 106 per share, yielding 7.97% based on the closing price of IDR 1,330 per share on 20 March. The record date and final payment date have not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Reports February 2025 Same-Store Sales Decline
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia reported same-store sales growth (SSSG) of –6.6% year-on-year in February 2025, compared with +3.4% in January 2025 and +15.3% in February 2024. The decline was observed across all regions, with the smallest drop in Outside Java (-4% YoY), followed by Jakarta (-7.8% YoY) and Java outside Jakarta (-8.1% YoY). Management attributed the slowdown to a high-base effect from February 2024, which was boosted by the 2024 presidential election. Total store count reached 247 at the end of February 2025, up one store from the end of January 2025.

tickerNews.title: Barito Pacific Eyes Property IPOs and SECP Acquisition
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific’s management said in the 4Q24 earnings call on Wednesday, 19 March, that the group is considering taking its property subsidiary PT Griya Idola and its sub-subsidiary PT Chandra Daya Investasi public. The company emphasized that any IPO will only proceed when the businesses are fully prepared. Management also targeted the acquisition of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore (SECP) and the start of operations of the Jawa 9 & 10 coal-fired power plants owned by PT Indo Raya Tenaga, which are expected to be reflected in the 2025 financial statements.

tickerNews.title: PWON Sets IDR 2.71 Trillion 2025 Capex, Focus on Super-Block Expansion
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati announced a capital expenditure plan of IDR 2.71 trillion for 2025, unchanged from the 2024 allocation. The capex will mainly fund the super-block projects under construction, such as the expansion of the Kota Kasablanka and Gandaria City super-blocks. Approximately 13% of the capex will be allocated to mall-business development, with a focus on expanding malls in Semarang and Batam over the next five years, according to Director of Business Development Ivy Wong.

tickerNews.title: BEST Targets 20-Hectare Land Sale in 2025, Aims for IDR 600 Billion Revenue
tickerNews.content: Bekasi Fajar Industrial Estate (BEST) targets the sale of 20 hectares of land in 2025, aiming for revenue of about IDR 600 billion (2024 target: IDR 600 billion; 9M-2024 actual: IDR 404 billion). Head of Corporate Finance & Investor Relations Calvin Neonardi said the company is now focusing on land sales for data-center projects due to strong demand since last year. The company also allocated IDR 200 billion of capex for warehouse construction and land acquisition.

tickerNews.title: Arsjad Rasjid to Become Principal Commissioner of XLSmart Telecom (EXCL)
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Arsjad Rasjid will become the principal commissioner of XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera Tbk, the entity created by the merger of XL Axiata and Smartfren Telecom. The announcement, received by Kontan on Thursday, 20 March, said Arsjad will attend the merger press conference as the incoming chief commissioner of XLSmart and will also serve as a speaker at the event. Arsjad currently holds the position of President Director at Indika Energy (INDY).

tickerNews.title: HATM Plans IDR 400 Billion Bulk-Carrier Purchase, Total 2025 Capex IDR 500 Billion
tickerNews.content: Habco Trans Maritima’s President Director Andrew Kam said the company plans to purchase two bulk-carrier vessels worth IDR 400 billion this year, increasing its fleet to seven bulk carriers. The acquisition is intended to capture opportunities in the bulk-commodity shipping sector and will add 90,000–100,000 tonnes of transport capacity. HATM has budgeted a total capex of IDR 500 billion for 2025, of which IDR 100 billion is earmarked for ship maintenance. The required funds will be raised through a rights issue targeting IDR 537.6 billion.

tickerNews.title: LABA Announces Rights Issue and Share Transfers Valued at Up to IDR 900 Billion
tickerNews.content: Green Power Group announced a rights issue of up to 6 billion shares, with a maximum proceeds amount of IDR 900 billion, implying a maximum dilution of 84% at an exercise price of about IDR 150 per share. The rights issue will see controlling shareholders contribute assets including a nickel mine and office buildings and raise cash. In a separate transaction, controlling shareholder PT Nev Stored Energy transferred 55 million (4.99%) of LABA shares and sold 165 million (14.95%) shares, at average prices of IDR 160 and IDR 140 per share respectively on 28 February 2025. The two deals total approximately IDR 8.8 billion and IDR 23.1 billion. The transactions are intended to secure shares and develop LABA and its subsidiaries. After the transactions, PT Nev Stored Energy’s ownership in LABA fell from 46.13% to 26.19%.
